clfEcocCode

PURPOSE

Generates optimal ECOC codes when 3<=nclasses<=7.

SYNOPSIS

function [C,nbits] = clfEcocCode( k )

DESCRIPTION 

 Generates optimal ECOC codes when 3<=nclasses<=7.

 USAGE
  [C,nbits] = clfEcocCode( k )

 INPUTS
  k      - number of classes

 OUTPUTS
  C      - code
  nbits  - number of bits

 EXAMPLE

 See also CLFECOC

SOURCE CODE 

0001 function [C,nbits] = clfEcocCode( k )
0002 % Generates optimal ECOC codes when 3<=nclasses<=7.
0003 %
0004 % USAGE
0005 %  [C,nbits] = clfEcocCode( k )
0006 %
0007 % INPUTS
0008 %  k      - number of classes
0009 %
0010 % OUTPUTS
0011 %  C      - code
0012 %  nbits  - number of bits
0013 %
0014 % EXAMPLE
0015 %
0016 % See also CLFECOC
0017 %
0018 % Piotr's Image&Video Toolbox      Version 2.0
0019 % Copyright 2008 Piotr Dollar.  [pdollar-at-caltech.edu]
0020 % Please email me if you find bugs, or have suggestions or questions!
0021 % Licensed under the Lesser GPL [see external/lgpl.txt]
0022 
0023 if( k<3 || k>7 )
0024   error( 'method only works if k is small: 3<=k<=7'); end
0025 
0026 % create C
0027 C = ones(k,2^(k-1));
0028 for i=2:k
0029   partw = 2^(k-i);  nparts = 2^(i-2);
0030   row = [zeros(1,partw) ones(1,partw)];
0031   row = repmat( row, 1, nparts );
0032   C(i,:) = row;
0033 end
0034 C = C(:,1:end-1);
0035 nbits = size(C,2);
0036 
0037 % alter C to have entries [-1,1]
0038 C(C==0)=-1;
